intro: Rubus lecoqui, commonly known as the Lecouqui blackberry, is a species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. The plant is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves, typical of many Rubus species. Its flowers are small and white, followed by dark purple to black berries that are edible. The plant plays an important role in local ecosystems and is also valued for its ornamental and culinary uses.
